seo.title: Naples to Positano: step‑by‑step
seo.description: Year‑round route via Sorrento train + SITA bus, where to get off in Positano, and how to walk to Hostel Brikette — plus summer ferry and late‑arrival options.

intro: From Naples Airport or city, reach Positano year‑round by taking a shuttle or Alibus + train to Sorrento, then the SITA bus toward Amalfi. In summer, ferries run when seas are calm. This guide shows exactly where to get off (Chiesa Nuova/Bar Internazionale) and how to walk the final 2–5 minutes to Hostel Brikette.

sections.title: Train + bus (year‑round)
body: Airport → Sorrento: From NAP arrivals, either take the Curreri shuttle to Sorrento (direct, paid on board/online) or ride the Alibus to Napoli Centrale/Garibaldi and connect to the Circumvesuviana train for Sorrento.
At Sorrento: Exit the station and follow signs to the bus stands. Buy SITA tickets at the tabacchi/newsstand (you must have a validated ticket before boarding).

sections.title: Sorrento → Positano by SITA
body: Board the SITA bus signed for Amalfi/Positano. Luggage goes underneath; keep valuables with you. Services are more frequent in summer but can be busy — arrive early and queue.
Ride the coastal road past Priora and Piano; after the village of Montepertuso turnoff, you will descend toward Positano’s upper stops.

sections.title: Get off at ‘Chiesa Nuova’ (Bar Internazionale)
body: For Hostel Brikette, alight at ‘Chiesa Nuova’ outside the café/bar called Bar Internazionale. This is the closest stop to the hostel.
The ride length and number of stops vary with traffic. From the stop, the hostel is roughly 140 m (450 ft) away with minimal stairs.

sections.title: Walk to Hostel Brikette
body: From the Bar Internazionale stop, continue in the same direction the bus was traveling for just over 100 m (330 ft) along Viale Pasitea.
Look for the Hostel Brikette sign on the terrace level. Continue around the bend and take the stairs on the right up to the main door.

sections.title: Ferry (summer)
body: From Naples city, take the Alibus to Molo Beverello, then a ferry to Positano (seasonal; weather‑dependent). Confirm times and fares on the day and avoid the last sailing if you have onward plans.
From the dock in Positano, combine the Interno Positano bus with porters if carrying luggage — see our %LINK:ferryDockToBrikette|dock → hostel route% and %LINK:porterServices|porter guide%.

sections.title: Late arrivals & transfers
body: If you arrive after the last bus/ferry, book a private transfer or plan an overnight near the station in Naples or in Sorrento.
Confirm the drop‑off near your accommodation and ask about luggage handling if needed.

faqs.q: Where do I buy SITA tickets?
a: At tabacchi/newsagents near the stands in Sorrento and at Bar Internazionale in Positano. Buy before boarding and validate on the bus if required.

faqs.q: Which stop is best for the hostel?
a: ‘Chiesa Nuova’ (outside Bar Internazionale). It is the closest stop to Hostel Brikette and avoids long staircases.

faqs.q: How long is the final walk?
a: About 2–5 minutes and roughly 140 m (450 ft) with only a short staircase at the entrance.
